--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
=
>
> callforshadab wrote:
> > Hi All,
> > Is there anyway to save links with=
out saving the contents of the
> > crawl??
> 
> You could create your own L=
inksWriter and use it in place of ARCWriter.
> 
> Your LinkWriter would ope=
n a file and per CrawlURI, it'd dump the 
> CrawlURI URI and all its outlin=
ks.  The outlinks are put into the 
> CrawlURI by the extractors.  See Link=
sScoper for example code on how to 
> get the links out of the CrawlURI: 
>=

http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/postprocessor/LinksSco=
per.html#135.
> 
> > I understood that if we are using the bdbfrontier, it =
stores
> > all links and the domain queues in *.jdb files. Can i extract al=
l
> > domains that it has in its list alongwith the urls belonging to that
=
> > domain.
> >
> You could use bdbje db dump tools to get at the bdbje db =
content but it 
> wouldn't be satisfactory.  The Bdb has only the URIs that=
 are in scope 
> and it only contains hashes of URIs, not the URIs themselv=
es.
> St.Ack
